thought: I dress so nicely for work. I will probably get mugged and stabbed to death on the street of New York.
scenario: i've a poodle named nanette . i actually like wearing suits and ties . i work on wall street . i love smooth jazz . i live in new york city . These are the things that run through my mind on quiet days. I dress so nicely for work. I will probably get mugged and stabbed to death on the street of New York. I've learned to accept these thoughts, even if they're a bit strange.

scenario: i commute by bus . i just started college . i work part time in the campus library . i've 3 science classes . I find myself reflecting on these traits quite often. I have always wondered why people do not put their books back at the library. Why should i have to do more work and put them back in place. It's strange how sometimes my mind wanders to these odd places, but I guess that's just a part of who I am.

persona: i m scared of left turns . i think i m failing my women s studies class . i got hired last week at mcdonald s . i have four siblings . i drive a blue honda civic .
pattern_def: A form of overgeneralization; attributing a person's actions to their character instead of to an attribute. Rather than assuming the behaviour to be accidental or otherwise extrinsic, one assigns a label to someone or something that is based on the inferred character of that person or thing.
thought: I got hired last week at McDonalds, probably because I'm not smart enough to do anything else and they know it.
scenario: i m scared of left turns . i think i m failing my women s studies class . i got hired last week at mcdonald s . i have four siblings . i drive a blue honda civic . I often revisit these ideas. I got hired last week at McDonalds, probably because I'm not smart enough to do anything else and they know it. It may not make sense to everyone, but to me, it's just a part of my world.
